utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ooh, more details about the new Star Trek film. There’s going to be a scene depicting Spock’s birth.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d be more interested in a scene depicting Spock’s conception.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please. For Vulcans, mating, or, if you will, Pon Farr, it’s an extremely private matter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Still, I’d like to know the details. His mother was human, his father was Vulcan, they couldn’t just conceive.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe they had to go to a clinic. Imagine Spock’s dad in a little room with a copy of pointy ears and shapely rears.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How come on Star Trek everybody’s private parts are the same. No alien lady ever told Captain Kirk, hey, get your thing out of my nose.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hi, can you help me, I was writing an email and the A key got stuck. Now it’s just going “aaaaaaa”.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did you spill on it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nothing. Diet coke. And yoghurt. A little nail polish.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll take a look at it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gentlemen, switching to local nerd news. Fishman, Chen, Chowdry, McNair aren’t fielding a team in the university physics bowl this year.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding, why not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They formed a barbershop quartet, and got a gig playing Knotsbury Farm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, so in your world, you’re like, the cool guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Recognise.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is our year! With those guys out, the entire physics bowl will kneel before Zod.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Zod?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Kryptonian villain. Long story.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good story.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well count me out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You want me to use my intelligence in a tawdry competition? Would you ask Picasso to play Pictionary? Would you ask Noah Webster to play Boggle? Would you ask Jacques Cousteau to play Go Fish?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, you need a four person team, we’re four people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: By that reasoning we should also play bridge, hold up a chuppah and enter the Olympic bobsled competition.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I want tickets to that please.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, what, do I need to quote Spock’s dying words to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, don’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The needs of the many.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Outweigh the needs of the few.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or the one. Dammit, I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. First order of physics bowl business. We need a truly kick-ass team name. Suggestions.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How about the perpetual motion squad? It’s beyond the laws of physics, plus a little heads up for the ladies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The ladies?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Perpetual motion squad, we can go all night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I like it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t. Teams are traditionally named after fierce creatures, thus intimidating ones opponent.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then we can be the Bengal Tigers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Poor choice. Gram for gram, no animal exceeds the relative fighting strength of the army ant.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe so. But you can’t incinerate a Bengal Tiger with a magnifying glass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s put it to a vote. All those in favour….

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Point of order. I move that any vote on team names should be unanimous. No man should be forced to emblazon his chest with the bengal tiger, when common sense dictates it should be an army ant.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will the gentleman from the great state of denial yield for a question?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I will yield.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: After we go through the exercise of an annoying series of votes, all of which the gentleman will lose, does he then intend to threaten to quit if he does not get his way?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He does.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I move we are the Army Ants, all those in favour?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good afternoon, and welcome to today’s physics bowl practice round. I’m Penny, and I’ll be your host, because apparently I didn’t have anything else to do on a Saturday afternoon, and isn’t that just a little sad? Gentlemen, are you ready?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fire away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, it’s none of my business, but isn’t a guy who can’t speak in front of women going to hold you back a little?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, uh, he’ll be okay once the women are mixed into the crowd. He only has a problem when they’re one on one and smell nice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thanks Raj, it’s vanilla oil.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was actually the one who noticed, okay, let’s just start.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, the first question is on the topic of optics. What is the shortest light pulse ever produced? Dr Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And of course, the answer is 130 adoseconds.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is correct.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I knew that too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good for you, sweetie. Okay, next question. What is the quantum mechanical effect used to encode data on hard disk drives? Howard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And of course, the answer is giant magneto resistance.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I buzzed in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I answered, it’s called teamwork.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t you think I should answer the engineering questions? I am an engineer.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: By that logic I should answer all the anthropology questions because I’m a mammal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just ask another one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. What artificial satellite has seen glimpses of Einsteins predicted frame dragging?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And of course it’s Gravity Probe B.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you have to let somebody else answer.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because it’s polite.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do manners have to do with it? This is war. Were the Romans polite when they salted the ground of Carthage to make sure nothing would ever grow again?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, you said I only had to ask questions.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The objective of the competition is to give correct answers, if I know them, why shouldn’t I give them?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Some of us might have the correct answers too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh please, you don’t even have a PhD.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Alright, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, sit down.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: maybe we should take a little break.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good idea, I need my wrist brace, all this button pushing is aggravating my old Nintendo injury.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers in his ear)
utterance.content: I agree.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He compared Sheldon to a disposable feminine cleansing product one might use on a summer’s eve.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, and the bag it came in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, excellent, I want to show you something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can it wait, I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just look. I’ve designed the perfect uniforms for our team. The colours are based on Star Trek, the original series. The three of you will wear support red, and I will wear command gold.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why do they say AA?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Army Ants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Isn’t that confusing? AA might mean something else to certain people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would a physics bowl team be called anodised aluminium?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I meant…. never mind. Hey, check it out. I got you a Batman cookie jar!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh neat, what’s the occasion?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you’re a friend, and you like Batman, and cookies, and you’re off the team.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, Raj and I just had a team meeting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes we did, I just came from it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I don’t know where you just came from, but it couldn’t have been a team meeting because I’m on the team and I wasn’t there, ergo the team did not meet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, let me try it this way, uh, I was at a coffee klatch with a couple of friends and one thing led to another and it turns out you’re off the team.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because you’re taking all the fun out of it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m sorry, is the winner of the physics bowl the team that has the most fun?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, let me try it this way, you’re annoying and no-one wants to play with you any more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see. Well. At this point I should inform you that I intend to form my own team and destroy the molecular bonds that bind your very matter together, and reduce the resulting particulate chaos to tears.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks for the heads up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re welcome. One more thing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s on, bitch.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So who’d he get to be on his team.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He won’t say. He just smiles, and eats macaroons out of his bat jar.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s using psychological warfare. We must reply in kind. I say we wait until he looks at us, then laugh like, yes, you are a smart and strong competitor, but we are also smart and strong and we have a reasonable chance of defeating you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How exactly would that laugh go?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That sounds more like, we are a tall thin woman who wants to make a coat out of your Dalmatians.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Guys, let’s remember that Sheldon is still our friend and my room mate.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So nothing, let’s destroy him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (walking past)
utterance.content: Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, we’re going to need a strong fourth for our team.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know who’s apparently very smart, is the girl who played TV’s Blossom. She got a PhD in neuroscience or something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj, we’re not getting TV’s Blossom to join our physics bowl team.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How about the girl from the Wonder Years?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I believe I’ve found the solution to all our problems.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We can’t ask Leslie Winkle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why? Because you slept together and when she was done with you she discarded you like last night’s chutney?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sometimes you’ve got to take one for the team.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Sack up, dude.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. Here I go, taking one for the team. In the sack. Hey Leslie.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hi guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leslie, I have a question for you, and it might be a little awkward, you know, given that I…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hit that thang.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Leonard, there’s no reason to feel uncomfortable just because we’ve seen each other’s faces and naked bodies contorted in the sweet agony of coitus.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s not? Gee, cos it sure sounds like there should be.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Rest assured that any aspects of our sexual relationship regarding your preferences, your idiosyncrasies, your performance, are still protected by the inherent confidentiality of the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s all very comforting, but if it’s okay, I’d like to get on with my question now.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Proceed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We are entering the physics bowl and we need a fourth for our team.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: No thanks, I’m really busy with my like sign dilepton super symmetry search.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Dilepton, schmilepton, we need you.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, we tried. Just have to face Sheldon mano-e-mano-e-mano. A-mano.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Wait, you’re going up against Sheldon Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: That arrogant, misogynistic East-Texas doorknob that told me I should abandon my work with high energy particles for laundry and child bearing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, how do you feel? Nice and loose? Come to play? Got your game face on? Are you ready?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. You know you don’t have to stay for the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, I want to. It sounds really interesting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering in his Star Trek themed shirt)
utterance.content: Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee hee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon. I’m just going to sit down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, is that your team.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I don’t need a team, I could easily defeat you single-handedly. But the rules require four, so may I introduce, the third floor janitor, he lady from the lunchroom, and, my Spanish is not good, either her son or her butcher. And what about your team? What rat have you recruited to the SS Sinking Ship?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leslie Winkle?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Yeah, Leslie Winkle. The answer to the question, who made Sheldon Cooper cry like a little girl?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, well, I’m polymerised tree sap and you’re non-organic adhesive so, whatever verbal projectile you launch in my direction is reflected off of me, returns on its original trajectory, and adheres to you.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Oh, ouch.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gablehouser
utterance.content: Okay, if everyone could please take your seats.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here’s your tee-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: PMS? It’s a couple of days early, but…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it stands for Perpetual Motion Squad.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Oh, right, of course, what was I thinking?

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Good afternoon everyone, and welcome to this year’s physics bowl. Today’s preliminary match features two great teams… AA versus PMS.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All night long, y’all!

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Okay, well let’s jump right in, first question, for ten points. What is the isospan singlet partner of the Pi Zero Meson? PMS?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The Eta Meson.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Correct.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Formal protest.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: On what grounds?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The Velcro on my wrist brace caught on my shirt.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Denied. Alright, for ten points, what is the lightest element on earth with no stable isotope. AA?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And of course, the answer is Technetium.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Terrific. Next question, what is the force between two uncharged plates due to quantum vacuum fluctuation. PMS?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon can suck on, the Casimir Effect.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Correct.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: How does a quantum computer factor large numbers. PMS?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Shor’s Algorithm.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Correct.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: 4.1855 times ten to the seventh ergs per calorie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Prevost’s theory of exchanges.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Lamda equals one over Pi R squared N

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: 760 degrees celsius, the approximate temperature of the young lady in the front row.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Mr Wolowitz, this is your second warning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A sigma particle.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Yes, assuming the hypothetical planet has a mass greater than the earth.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Correct. Ladies and gentlemen, I hold in my hand the final question. The score now stands AA 1150, PMS 1175. So, for one hundred points, and the match, please turn your attention to the formula on the screens. Solve the equation.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Holy crap.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What the hell is that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It looks like something they found on the ship at Roswell.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, think, Leslie.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Leonard, it’s not going to work if you rush me, you have to let me get there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re never going to let that go, are you?

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Ten seconds. PMS.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, I panicked.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then guess.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, eight. Point four.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s incorrect. AA, if you can answer correctly, the match is yours.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He doesn’t have it. He’s got squat.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: AA, I need your answer.

utterance.speaker: Third Floor Janitor
utterance.content: The answer is minus eight by alpha.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hang on, hang on a second, that’s not our answer. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Third Floor Janitor
utterance.content: Answering question. Winning physics bowl.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How do you know anything about physics?

utterance.speaker: Third Floor Janitor
utterance.content: Here I am janitor, in former Soviet Union I am physicist. Leningrad Politechnica. Go Polar Bears.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well that’s a delightful little story, but our arrangement was that you sit here and not say anything, I answer the questions.

utterance.speaker: Third Floor Janitor
utterance.content: You didn’t answer question.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey look, now maybe you have democracy now in your beloved Russia, but on this physics bowl team I rule with an iron fist. . Ow!

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: AA, I need your official answer.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well it’s not what he said.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want a different question.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: You can’t have a different question.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Formal protest.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Denied.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Informal protest.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Denied. I need your official answer.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. I decline to provide one.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Well, that’s too bad, because the answer your teammate gave was correct.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s your opinion.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: Alright, the winner of the match is…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. Sheldon, is proving that you are single-handedly smarter than everyone else so important that you would rather lose by yourself than win as part of a team.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand the question.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Gablehouser
utterance.content: The winner is PMS!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, somebody’s sitting there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My Physics Bowl Trophy!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That trophy is meaningless, I forfeited, therefore you did not win.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know someone who would disagree.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My Physics Bowl Trophy! “Leonard is so smart, Sheldon who?”

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alright that is very immature.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right, I’m sorry. I’m not!

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Okay, new contest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m settling once and for all who is the smartest around here. Okay, are you ready?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bring it on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Marsha, Jan and Cindy were the three daughters of what TV family? The Brady Bunch. Okay, Sammy Hagar replaced David Lee Roth as the lead singer in what group?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (after they look at each other in confusion)
utterance.content: The Brady Bunch?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Van Halen. Alright, Madonna was married to this Ridgemont High alum. Oh my God, Sean Penn!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How do you know these things?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I go outside and I talk to people. Alright, here, what actor holds the record for being named people magazine’s sexiest man alive?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: William Shatner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, I don’t think it’s Shatner.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then it’s got to be Patrick Stewart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Formal protest.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alright, singer who sang “Oops I Did It Again.” Okay, Tweetie Bird, taught he taw a what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (after they pass a smug look between each other)
utterance.content: Romulan.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. He taught he taw a Romulan.
